description.value:
In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability.This @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.ZMMOwoWhgylf3hP5]{link} will take you to a list.

At 2nd level, you gain one eldritch invocation of your choice. If you want to be a warlock who uses weapons in combat, we recommend@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.c1lEKIaiHk8rQNMa]{Invocation: Eldritch Weapon} for your first invocation. When you reach levels 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 15, and 18 you gain another invocation, as shown in the Warlock Table.

When you gain a warlock level, you can choose one of the invocations you know and replace it with another invocation that you meet the requirements for. If you replace an invocation, you lose all benefits from that invocation. You cannot replace an invocation that is the prerequisite for another invocation or feat you possess.

A level prerequisite in an invocation refers to warlock level, not character level.
